headline: Third-Quarter Earnings Should Be Strong—but the Bar Is High
summary: Third-quarter earnings season kicks off in earnest this week, with roughly 12% of the  reporting results, and it is shaping up to be a good one.  In a typical year, analysts start to get nervous about their third-quarter earnings per share forecasts, leading to downward revision that can contribute to a September selloff.  In fact, analysts normally would have cut between 3% and 4% since the end of June, but this was the first year since 2023 that that didn’t happen, notes Bank of America’s Equity and Quant Strategist Savita Subramanian on Monday.

headline: Evaluating Bank of America’s Valuation as Stablecoin Ambitions Make Headlines
summary: If you have been wondering what to do about Bank of America stock, you are in good company. Plenty of investors are asking whether it is time to hold, buy, or start trimming positions. The past twelve months have offered both opportunity and reason for pause. After all, Bank of America’s shares are up an impressive 18.8% over the last year, and a staggering 131.7% over five years, signaling sizeable long-term growth. But it has not been all smooth sailing. In the last month, the stock has...

headline: Markets are hoping China-US trade tensions will ease
summary: US stocks surged before the bell on Monday, bouncing back from Friday's rout after President Trump played down the escalating US trade standoff with China, saying it "will all be fine!" Russ Mould, Investment Director at AJ Bell believes that markets are hoping that President Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping will still meet at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in South Korea later this month. For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

headline: Bank earnings: Why Goldman and Citi could outperform the pack
summary: Earnings season is about to kick off for Big Banks this week, with JPMorgan (JPM), Wells Fargo (WFC), Goldman Sachs (GS), and Citigroup (C) reporting quarterly results on Tuesday, October 14, followed by Bank of America (BAC) and Morgan Stanley (MS) on Wednesday. CFRA Research Director of Equity Research Ken Leon sits down with Market Domination host Josh Lipton to discuss the two banking leaders that his firm likes ahead of their earnings. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

CFRA Research Director of Equity Research Ken Leon sits down with Market Domination host Josh Lipton to discuss the two banking leaders that his firm likes ahead of their earnings.

headline: Is the Stock Market Open Today? Here Are the Trading Hours for Columbus Day.
summary: Columbus Day has arrived, offering traders a moment of reprieve from the tumultuous news cycle—but not everyone will catch a break.  Is the Stock Market Open or Closed on Columbus Day?  The New York Stock Exchange and the Nasdaq Stock Market will both be open on Columbus Day, which is a federal holiday.

content.title: Is the Stock Market Open Today? Here Are the Trading Hours for Columbus Day.
content.summary: Columbus Day has arrived, offering traders a moment of reprieve from the tumultuous news cycle—but not everyone will catch a break.
